Activity: Log in to the workstation and check emails. Review notes from yesterday's meetings and tasks completed.
Continue working on the SQL queries for data extraction. Optimize for performance and ensure accuracy. Document the purpose of each query step.
Implement the first version of the data quality report generation script. Use Python or R to automate the data extraction, calculation of metrics, and generation of visualizations.
Test the data quality report generation script on a larger dataset. Identify and fix any errors or performance bottlenecks. Refactor the code for readability and maintainability.
Lunch Break. Listen to music to get inspiration.

Focus on setting weekly improvement targets. Analyze historical data on influenza cases and EHR data quality to establish a baseline. Consider factors that might influence data quality (e.g., training programs, system upgrades).
Research statistical methods for setting improvement targets (e.g., control charts, goal setting theory). Select a method that is appropriate for the data and the project goals.
Set preliminary weekly improvement targets for each data quality metric. Document the rationale for each target and the method used to set it.
Email @itpm-1 to provide a status update on the project and discuss any potential risks or issues. @PEOPLE: ['itpm-1'] Topic: Project Status Update and Risk Assessment
Review the day's work and make a list of tasks for tomorrow.
